maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Camera driver object
The New-Camera cmdlet returns an ASCOM Camera driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Camera driver object.
Creates a new ASCOM Dome driver object
The New-Dome cmdlet returns an ASCOM Dome driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Dome driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new dome simulator driver and assigns it to the $dome variable

> $dome

dev:remarks.maml:para: Demonstrates using the Show-Chooser cmdlet to obtain a driver id, then using New-Telescope to open the driver.

> $scope
AlignmentMode : algPolar Altitude : ApertureArea : 0.0269 ApertureDiameter : 0.2 AtHome : AtPark : Azimuth : CanFindHome : True CanPark : True CanPulseGuide : True CanSetDeclinationRate : True CanSetGuideRates : True CanSetPark : True CanSetPierSide : False CanSetRightAscensionRate : True CanSetTracking : True CanSlew : True CanSlewAltAz : True CanSlewAltAzAsync : True CanSlewAsync : True CanSync : True CanSyncAltAz : True CanUnpark : True Connected : False Declination : DeclinationRate : 0 Description : Software Telescope Simulator for ASCOM Copyright © 2001-2002, SPACE.com DoesRefraction : DriverInfo : ASCOM Telescope Simulator 5.0.9 Developed by Robert B. Denny, DC-3 Dreams, SP Copyright © 2001, SPACE.com Canada, Ltd. http://ascom-standards.org/ http://www.starrynight.com/ DriverVersion : 5.0 EquatorialSystem : equLocalTopocentric FocalLength : 1.26 GuideRateDeclination : GuideRateRightAscension : InterfaceVersion : 2 IsPulseGuiding : Name : I_Simulator RightAscension : RightAscensionRate : 0 SideOfPier : SiderealTime : 15.3078102816513 SiteElevation : 432.591736316681 SiteLatitude : 59.6314787864685 SiteLongitude : 15.3904178738594 SlewSettleTime : 0 Slewing : TargetDeclination : TargetRightAscension : Tracking : TrackingRate : driveSidereal TrackingRates : UTCDate : 04/07/2010 19:26:06

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Util object

Returns an ASCOM Util object, it offers the following functions Util.DegreesToDM() Util.DegreesToDMS() Util.DegreesToHM() Util.DegreesToHMS() Util.DMSToDegrees() Util.FormatVar() Util.HMSToDegrees() Util.HMSToHours() Util.HoursToHM() Util.HoursToHMS() Util.LoadDLL() Util.LTrimString() Util.MessageBox() Util.RTrimString() Util.TrimString() Util.WaitForMilliseconds() Util.Yield()
An ASCOM Util object, performs some useful general purpose functions.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns an ASCOM Util object, see the ASCOM documentation for a full explanation of the capabilies.
> $util PlatformVersion : 5.5 SerialTraceFile : C:\SerialTrace.txt SerialTrace : False TimeZoneName : GMT Daylight Time TimeZoneOffset : -1 UTCDate : 04/07/2010 18:31:28 JulianDate : 2455382.27185955

maml:description.maml:para: Display the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
Display the ASCOM Chooser dialog.

If specified, the DeviceType parameter forces the Chooser dialog to only display installed drivers corresponding to that type. By default if no DeviceType is specified then only Telescope drivers are displayed.

If you supply a DriverID, the corresponding driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser's list when the Chooser window is first opened. The parameter is optional, and if omitted or passed "", no driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser window.

If specified, the DeviceType parameter forces the Chooser dialog to only display installed drivers corresponding to that type. By default if no DeviceType is specified then only Telescope drivers are displayed.

If you supply a DriverID, the corresponding driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser's list when the Chooser window is first opened. The parameter is optional, and if omitted or passed "", no driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser window.
A string representing the selected device drivers internal name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays the Chooser for the default Telescope drivers
Shows the Chooser with Dome drivers in the selection list
Shows the Chooser with the default Telescope drivers listed, the Simulator driver will be pre-selected in the list.
